block.p: Jet-setters have one fewer reason to bemoan the airline toiletry ban: superpotent sunscreen is now available stateside. The F.D.A. has approved Mexoryl SX, the UVA-blocking ingredient that is a major component of L'Oréal's Anthelios SC, a beauty-junkie favorite previously available only in Europe, Canada and Mexico. While the competition was waiting, Johnson & Johnson developed Helioplex technology, combining already-approved ingredients to the same end. What's the big deal? Till now, even the best sunscreens protected against cancer-causing rays for only about two hours; the new products last up to four. So go ahead: take a quick nap on the beach. Dr. Darrell Rigel, the president-elect of the American Society for Dermatologic Surgery, calls the ingredients ''the greatest breakthroughs in preventing skin cancer in a decade.'' Now, if scientists could only solve that other threat to beachgoers: global warming.
